etymology.description: semantic: 頁(頁) (yè, 'leaf, page') + phonetic: 彥(彥) (yàn, 'accomplished person') -> 顏(顏, 'face')
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 顏(顏) (yán, 'face, countenance') combines 頁(頁) (yè, 'leaf, page') as the semantic component, representing the face, with 彥(彥) (yàn, 'accomplished person') for its phonetic value, suggesting a distinguished appearance or expression. The elements relate to physical presence and facial expression.
etymology.simplification: The traditional components were simplified: 彥(彥) (yàn, 'accomplished person') was simplified to 彦(彦) and 頁(頁) (yè, 'leaf, page') was simplified to 页(页), maintaining three of the original lines for resemblance.

examples.chinese: 我认识颜老师(我認識顏老師)。
颜先生家在北京(顏先生家在北京)，他的家族历史悠久(他的家族歷史悠久)。
examples.pinyin: Yán xiānsheng jiā zài Běijīng, tā de jiāzú lìshǐ yōujiǔ.
examples.english: Mr. Yan's home is in Beijing, and his family history is long.
